The Fulbright Program is the flagship international educational exchange program sponsored by the U.S. government and is designed to build lasting connections between the people of the United States and the people of other countries. The Fulbright U.S. Student Program awards grants each year to rising and graduating seniors, current graduate students, and recent alumni students who are thinking of earning a Master’s degree, conducting research or teaching English in more than 140 countries worldwide. The English Language Institute (ELI) provides high quality training to those who need strengthen their English skills in speaking, listening, reading, writing, and/or grammar for their personal and professional goals. The programs include Intensive English Program (IEP), Academic English Program (AEP), TESOL, Test Prep (TOEFL, IELTS, and GRE), skill-focused training (e.g., Accent Reduction, Professional/Business Writing, Conversation Skills, etc.) and more. The ELI also assists UMBC as a whole by providing cross cultural services in an ever changing world.
